climbs.name: Thagomizer
climbs.fa: Alec Isabeau, Jerry Dodrill, Eric Berghorn

content.description: The climbing here is better than it looks. Climb out of the scoop, delicately stemming and liebacking through the crux 2nd bolt. Optional rest on big ledge off right, or keep going up the seam and features to rings at the top. You should definitely do the top out.
content.protection: This line was cleaned and TR'd by J. Dodrill. Before bolting it, Alec Isabeau led a variation from the left, entirely on gear. Eventually the original line was bolted by Dodrill and Berghorn. Six bolts to chains.  The gear line climbs steep broken cracks from the left and joins above the ledge.
content.location: Directly up from obvious steep scoop/groove.

content.description: Bouldery start to sustained liebacking on slightly overhanging face.
content.location: Just to the right of the hidden corner (5.7) on the left side of the Thagomizer cliff.

content.description: Right of Thagomizer, climb one of two variations above the second bolt, either going left onto the steep arete, or straight up through thin face moves, then up a steep face to anchor rings to the right.
